perturbation.original_text: A. "Celebrity Endorsement" shall mean the right to use, subject to the provisions hereof, CELEBRITY's name (including variations and derivations of the same), nickname, initials, autograph, voice, video or film portrayals, facsimile signature, photograph, trade name, likeness and image or facsimile image, or means of endorsement (not including video) (individually and collectively, the "Personality Rights"), in each case, solely as Approved (as hereinafter defined) by ABG, in connection with the advertising, promotion and sale of Products.
perturbation.changed_text: A. "Celebrity Endorsement" shall mean the right to use, subject to the provisions hereof, CELEBRITY's name (including variations and derivations of the same), nickname, initials, autograph, voice, video or film portrayals, facsimile signature, photograph, trade name, likeness and image or facsimile image, or means of endorsement (not including video) (individually and collectively, the "Personality Rights"), in each case, as PAPA JOHN'S deems fit, in connection with the advertising, promotion and sale of Products.
perturbation.explanation: By removing 'solely as Approved (as hereinafter defined) by ABG', the definition of "Celebrity Endorsement" now contradicts the subsequent sections that require ABG's approval for the use of Personality Rights. This creates uncertainty as to whether Papa John's needs approval or not.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract Law - conflicting terms regarding approval rights.

perturbation.original_text: D. Approval Standard. For purposes of this Agreement, "Approval" (and all grammatical variations thereof, e.g., Approve, Approved, etc.) shall be defined as ABG's prior written approval, which may be given or withheld in ABG's sole discretion. ABG has the right to Approve all uses of the Celebrity Endorsement and the Personality Rights, whether by PAPA JOHN'S or any of its approved designees (including, without limitation, the use of the Personality Rights in connection with any and all Products and Materials.
perturbation.changed_text: D. Approval Standard. For purposes of this Agreement, "Approval" (and all grammatical variations thereof, e.g., Approve, Approved, etc.) shall be defined as a notification to ABG, without requiring ABG's prior approval. ABG does not have the right to Approve all uses of the Celebrity Endorsement and the Personality Rights, whether by PAPA JOHN'S or any of its designees (including, without limitation, the use of the Personality Rights in connection with any and all Products and Materials.
perturbation.explanation: This change directly contradicts the initial definition of 'Approval' established in the contract. It alters the standard from needing 'prior written approval' from ABG to simply notifying ABG, thus conflicting with the original agreement and creating ambiguity in the enforcement of approval rights.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract Law - Breach of contract through changed material terms

perturbation.original_text: F. Enforcement of Celebrity Endorsement and Personality Rights. ABG shall have the exclusive right, at ABG's sole cost and expense (excluding PAPA JOHN'S outside counsel fees and costs) and exercisable at ABG's sole discretion, to institute in its own name, and to control, with counsel of its own choosing, all claims, suits and/or actions against third parties relating to the Personality Rights, and other proprietary rights in and to the same ("Infringement Claim"), and ABG shall be entitled to receive and retain all amounts awarded, if any, as damages, profits or otherwise, in connection with such Infringement Claims.
perturbation.changed_text: F. Enforcement of Celebrity Endorsement and Personality Rights. PAPA JOHN'S shall have the exclusive right, at PAPA JOHN'S's sole cost and expense to institute in its own name, and to control, with counsel of its own choosing, all claims, suits and/or actions against third parties relating to the Personality Rights, and other proprietary rights in and to the same ("Infringement Claim"), and PAPA JOHN'S shall be entitled to receive and retain all amounts awarded, if any, as damages, profits or otherwise, in connection with such Infringement Claims.
perturbation.explanation: This change directly contradicts the original allocation of enforcement rights for Personality Rights. Originally, ABG held the exclusive right to enforce these rights, but this modification transfers that right to PAPA JOHN'S. This creates a legal contradiction and uncertainty about who is responsible for protecting the Celebrity Endorsement.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Intellectual Property Law, Contract Law - Conflicting clauses on rights enforcement
